sections.heading: Overview
content:
Mark S. Litwin, MD, is an associate professor in the University of
California at Los Angeles (UCLA) Schools of Medicine and Public Health. He
holds the only such joint faculty appointment in the United States.

Litwin graduated magna cum laude from Duke University with a bachelor's
degree in economics and attended medical school at Emory University. He
completed his residency training in urological surgery at Harvard Medical
School's Brigham and Women's Hospital. He then spent two years as a Robert Wood
Johnson Clinical Scholar at RAND and UCLA, where he also earned his master's
degree public health. He published the first well-validated instrument to
assess disease-targeted health-related quality of life in men treated for
prostate cancer and has been an international leader in this area. His
instrument, the UCLA Prostate Cancer Index (JAMA 1995), is now in use in over
200 studies throughout North America and has been translated into Spanish,
Dutch, and Japanese for cross-cultural use.
